Pre-Game Insights: India has dominated the home World Cup with three wins out of three games.
Bangladesh suffered its second consecutive defeat in the tournament after losing to New Zealand by seven wickets in Chennai.
Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan could miss the game in Pune due to a fitness issue.
The Rohit Sharma-led Team India has dominated every opponent so far in the tournament.
The Bangladeshi batting has been their biggest letdown so far as the top order has failed to fire and the experienced duo of Shakib Al Hasan and Mushfiqur Rahim have looked decent.
Similarly, the bowling attack hasn't looked potent and has been one of the key reasons behind their poor start.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The MCA Stadium in Pune has produced great batting tracks with an average score of 305.
Here, the batters tend to capitalise on its small boundaries.
But bowlers can come as the pitch allows fast bowlers to extract some movement with the new ball, especially in the second innings.
Similarly, the spinners could get some turn as the pitch settles down.
